SENT.plain: INTRODUCTION: Thromboembolic events are serious complications in patients with inflammatory bowel disease

EXEGESIS: An 18-year-old patient, with a one year history of ulcerative colitis, presented with cerebral venous thrombosis during the decreasing period of corticotherapy after an active phase of the disease
Under treatment, the neurological disorder rapidly improved
CONCLUSION: The role of acquired and inherited risks factors is discussed
